tuv.seg: Residence rights of family members
Cearta cónaithe do bhaill teaghlaigh
If you move to Ireland for whatever reason, you may be able to bring your family members to live with you
Cibé cúis a bhíonn agat chun bogadh go hÉirinn, tá seans ann go mbeidh tú in ann baill do theaghlaigh a thabhairt chun cónaí leat sa tír seo
Your rights in this respect depend on your nationality and on the type of residence entitlement you have
Sa chás seo, braitheann do chearta ar do náisiúntacht nó ar an sórt cead cónaithe a bhíonn agat
Your family members’ right to stay in Ireland depends on your entitlement
Braitheann cead fanachta bhaill do theaghlaigh in Éirinn ar do chead fanachta
They may of course, acquire an entitlement in their own right
Ar ndóigh, is féidir leo siúd teidlíocht a fháil ina seilbh dhílis féin
A foreign national who marries or enters into a civil partnership with an Irish citizen does not have an automatic entitlement to live in Ireland
Má phósann náisiúnach eachtrach saoránach Éireannach ní thugann sé seo teidlíocht cónaithe uathoibríoch dó/di
Your spouse or civil partner is governed by the same rules as apply to all foreign nationals
Caithfidh do chéile nó pháirtnéir sibhialta na rialacha céanna a leanúint cosúil le gach náisiúnach eachtrannach
You can find a leaflet on residency information for family members and partners of Irish citizens on the website of Crosscare Migrant Project
Tá bileog maidir le faisnéis cónaithe do bhaill teaghlaigh agus pháirtnéirí saoránach Éireannacha ar fáil ar an suíomh gréasáin Tionscadail Imirceach Crosscare
Other EEA and Swiss citizens
Saoránaigh eile den AE/LEE agus saoránaigh na hEilvéise
If you are an EEA or Swiss citizen living in Ireland, then you have the right to bring certain family members to live with you here even if they are not themselves EEA or Swiss citizens

Más saoránach den LEE nó saoránach den Eilvéis thú i do chónaí in Éirinn, tá sé de cheart agat mar sin, baill áirithe teaghlaigh a thabhairt chun cónaí leat anseo in Éirinn, fiù amháin mura saoránaigh den AE/LEE nó saoránaigh den Eilvéis iad féin
The main EU legislation at present is set out in Regulation No 1612/58 and Directive 2004/38/EC (pdf)
Faoi láthair, leagtar amach príomhreachtaíocht an AE i Rialachán Uimh1612/58 agus Treorach 2004/38/PE (pdf)
The 2004 Directive is implemented in Ireland by the European Communities (Free Movement of Persons) Regulations 2015
Cuirtear Treorach 2004 i bhfeidhm in Éirinn le Rialacháin na gComhphobail Eorpach (Saorthaisteal Daoine) 2015
You can find more information about these EU Treaty Rights on the Irish Naturalisation and Immigration Service website
Tá tuilleadh faisnéise faoi na Cearta Conartha AE ar fáil ar shuíomh na Seirbhíse Eadóirseachta agus Inimirce na hÉireann
Most of the EU law on free movement also applies to citizens of the other EEA countries – Iceland, Norway and Liechtenstein
Baineann an chuid is mó de dhlí an AE ar shaorthaisteal, le saoránaigh na tíortha eile LEE - An Íoslainn, An Ioruaidh agus Lichtinstéin
There are agreements with Switzerland which mean that Swiss nationals are treated in broadly the same way as EU nationals
Tá conarthaí ann leis An Eilvéis a leagann amach go gcaitear mar an gcéanna, go ginearálta, le náisiúnaigh na hEilvéise agus le náisiúnaigh den AE
• Registered partners if the host member state treats such partnerships as equivalent to marriages; in Ireland civil partnership is equivalent to marriage for immigration purposes

• Páirtithe cláraithe má ghlacann an ballstáit óstach leis gur ionann na páirtíochtaí sin agus póstaí; in Éirinn aithnítear an páirtnéireacht sibhialta mar choibhéis pósta le haghaidh cuspóirí inimirce
• Direct descendants who are aged under 21 or are dependants (of the EU citizen and the spouse or civil partner)
• Sliocht díreach faoi bhun 21 bhliain d'aois, nó gur cleithiúnathe iad (den saoránach AE agus an chéile nó páirtí)
• Direct ancestors who are dependent
• Sinsear díreach atá ina c(h)leithiúnaí
Other family members who do not have an absolute right may be able to move to Ireland
Féadfaidh baill eile teaghlaigh, nach mbíonn i dteideal cearta uathoibhríocha, bogadh go hÉirinn
The Directive requires member states to facilitate the entry and residence of:
De réir na Treorach, caithfidh na baill stáit comhoibriú le teacht isteach agus cónaí:
• Family members who are dependants or members of the household of the EU citizen or where serious health grounds strictly require the personal care of the family member by the EU citizen and
• Baill teaghlaigh gur cleithiúnaithe iad nó baill teaghlaigh de shaoránach AE nó go gcaithfidh an saoránach AE aire pearsanta a thabhairt don bhall teaghlaigh de bharr cúiseanna sláinte dáiríre agus
• A partner with whom the EU citizen has a durable relationship
• Páirtí go bhfuil caidreamh buan aige/aici le saoránach an AE
The Irish authorities consider applications for residence cards from partners of EU nationals who can establish that the relationship has existed for at least 2 years
Déanann údaráis na hÉireann staidéar ar iarratais ar chártaí cónaithe ó pháirtithe náisiúnach AE gur féidir leo a thaispeáint go raibh caidreamh buan acu lena chéile ar feadh 2 bhliain ar a laghad
These other dependants or partners who are not qualifying family members are permitted family members
Mura na cleithiúnaithe eile nó pháirtithe baill teaghlaigh cáilithe iad, is baill teaghlaigh ceadaithe iad
The immigration authorities are required to undertake an extensive examination of the personal circumstances in these cases and must justify any refusal of entry or residence

Caithfidh na húdaráis inimirce scrúdú fairsing a dhéanamh ar chúinsí pearsanta sna cásanna seo, agus caithfear seasamh lena mbeart maidir le diúltú don iarratas teacht isteach nó diúltú don iarratas cónaí
In general, your family members retain the right to live here if you die or if they cease to be a spouse or civil partner
Go ginearálta, coimeádann baill do theaghlaigh teideal cónaithe fiú má fhaigheann tú bás nó murar céile nó páirtí iad a thuilleadh
You are entitled to permanent residence after 5 years
Tá teidlíocht agat do chónaí buan tar éis cúig bliana
Your family members have the same entitlement
Tá an teidlíocht céanna ag baill do theaghlaigh
People with international protection
Daoine le cosaint idirnáisiúnta

If you have international protection (refugee status or subsidiary protection) in Ireland or you are a Programme refugee, you may apply for members of your family to be given permission to come and live in Ireland

Má bhronntar cosaint idirnáisiunta (stáideas dídeanaí nó cosaint choimhdeach) duit, d'fhéadfá iarratas a sheoladh isteach chun cead isteach go hÉirinn agus cead cónaithe in Éirinn a fháil do bhaill do theaghlaigh
In general, the Minister for Justice and Equality must grant permission to your spouse, civil partner and dependent children aged under 18
Go ginearálta, caithfidh an tAire Dlí agus Cirt agus Comhionannais cead a thabhairt do do chéile nó pháirtnéir sibhialta agus do phaistí cleithiúnaithe faoi bhun18 mbliana d'aois
If you are under 18, permission must be granted to your parents
Mura bhfuil 18 mbliana slánaithe agat caithfear cead a thabhairt do do thuismitheoirí
People granted permission to remain on humanitarian grounds do not have all of the same rights as persons granted refugee or subsidiary protection status
Tá go leor de na cearta céanna ag daoine a fhaigheann cead fanachta ar chúis dhaonnúil agus atá ag daoine a bhaineann stádas dídeanaithe nó cosanta coimhdí amach
They do not have the right to family reunification but anyone who is entitled to reside and remain in the State may apply to the Minister to permit family members to join them
Níl an ceart acu chun athaontú teaghlaigh ach féadann aon duine a bhíonn i dteideal cónaí agus fanacht sa Stát cur isteach chuig an Aire chun ceadú do bhaill teaghlaigh a bheith leo
The Minister for Justice and Equality can grant or refuse permission on a discretionary basis
Féadann an tAire Dlí agus Cirt agus Comhionannais cead a bhronnadh nó a dhiúltú ar bhonn discréideach
If you are from outside the EEA or Switzerland, then your right to have family members come to live with you depends on the rules governing your presence in Ireland
Mura dtagann tú ón LEE nó ón Eilvéis, bíonn sé de cheart agat mar sin baill do theaghlaigh a thabhairt chun cónaí leat ag brath ar na rialacha a ghabhann le do láithreacht in Éirinn
At present, there is no legislation governing rights of residence for this group
Faoi láthair, níl reachtaíocht ar bith ag gabháil le cearta cónaithe an ghrúpa seo
The description here is of the current administrative arrangements
Níl anseo ach cur síos ar na sochruithe riaracháin reatha
It is open to you to apply to the Irish Naturalisation and Immigration Service (INIS) for anyone (including a partner) to be allowed join you in Ireland - see 'How to apply' below

Beidh ort féin iarratas a sheoladh isteach chuig Seirbhís Eadóirseachta agus Inimirce na hÉireann chun cead isteach a fháil d'éinne (ag cur páirtí san áireamh) teacht chun cónaí leat in Éirinn - féach 'Conas iarratas a dhéanamh' thíos
Family members are generally spouses, civil partners and children under the age of 18
De ghnáth, glaotar baill teaghlaigh ar chéilí/pháirtnéirí sibhialta agus ar pháistí faoi bhun 18 mbliana d'aois
It is not the general policy to allow dependants over the age of 18 to join you in Ireland
Ní polasaí ginearálta é cead a thabhairt do chleithiúnaithe os cionn 18 mbliana d'aois teacht chun cónaí leat in Éirinn
You may be able to make a case as to why you should be an exception to this general rule
B'fhéidir go bhféadfá an scéal a phlé chun a thaispeáint nár cheart tusa a chur san áireamh maidir leis an riail ginerálta seo
Your family members’ right to remain in Ireland depends on your right to remain
Braitheann cead fanachta bhaill do theaghlaigh in Éirinn ar do chead fanachta
They may of course, become entitled to a right of residence in their own right, for example, by getting a Critical Skills or General Employment Permit
D'fhéadfadh siad teacht i dteideal ar cheart cónaithe ina seilbh dhílis féin, mar shampla, trí Cead Fostaíochta Scileanna Ríthábhachtacha nó Cead Fostíochta Ginearálta a fháil
If you have a Critical Skills Employment Permit, you may bring your family to live with you in Ireland immediately
Má bhíonn Cead Fostaíochta Scileanna Ríthábhachtacha agat, d'fhéadfá do theaghlach a thabhairt chun cónaí leat in Éirinn láithreach bonn
Your spouse, civil partner and dependants may then get Dependant/Partner/Spousal Employment Permits
Beidh ceadanna oibre do chéile/do chleithiúnach ar fáil ansin ag do chéile, do pháirtnéir sibhialta agus ag do chuid cleithiúnaithe
If you have a General Employment Permit, you may be able to bring your family to live here after you have been legally working here for a year
Má bhíonn Cead Fostaíochta Ginearálta agat, d'fhéadfá do theaghlach a thabhairt chun cónaí anseo tar éis duit a bheith ag obair anseo go dlíthiúil ar feadh bliana
You also have to be able to show that you will be able to support them
Caithfidh tú a thaispeáint freisin go mbeidh tú ábalta déanamh dóibh
In practice, you need to be earning an income above the limits for Family Income Supplement
Go praicticiúil, beidh ort a bheith ag fáil tuarastail thar chuimse don Fhorlíonadh Ioncaim Teaghlaigh
Your spouse, civil partner and dependants aged under 18 may apply for a General Employment Permit once they are legally resident in Ireland
Nuair a bheidh cónaí dlíthiúil ag do chéile, do pháirtnéir sibhialta agus do chuid cleithiúnaithe faoi a 18 in Éirinn, beidh siad ábalta iarratas a sheoladh isteach ar chead oibre
It is not the general policy to allow family members to join students who are in Ireland as students
Ní polasaí ginearálta é go dtugtar cead do bhaill teaghlaigh teacht chun cónaí le mic léinn a bhíonn ag staidéar in Éirinn
You may be able to make a case as to why you should be an exception to this general rule
D'fhéadfá an scéal a phlé chun a thaispeáint nár cheart tusa a chur san áireamh maidir leis an riail ginearálta seo
Parents of Irish-born children
Tuismitheoirí le páistí a rugadh in Éirinn
If you have been granted residence in Ireland under the Irish Born Child Scheme, it is not the general policy to allow family members to come and live with you
Dá mba rud é gur tugadh cead cónaithe duit in Éirinn faoin Scéim um Leanaí a Rugadh in Éirinn, ní polasaí ginearálta é go dtugtar cead isteach do bhaill teaghlaigh chun cónaí leat anseo
You may be able to make a case as to why you should be an exception to this general rule
D'fhéadfá an scéal a phlé chun a thaispeáint nár cheart tusa a chur san áireamh maidir leis an riail ginearálta seo
Requirement to produce identity documents
Riachtanas doiciméid aitheantais a thabhairt ar aird

The Civil Law (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2011 (section 34) provides that non-EEA nationals arriving in the State must present a passport or equivalent document when asked for it by an immigration officer

Soláthraíonn an tAcht um an Dlí Sibhialta (Forálacha Ilghnéitheacha) 2011 alt 34 gur mór do náisiúnaigh neamh-LEE atá ag teacht isteach sa Stát, pas nó doiciméad coibhéiseach a thabhairt nuair a iarrann oifigeach imirce orthu
(Previously, it was not specifically stated that they had to present it.)
(Roimhe seo, ní raibh sé sonraithe gur mór dóibh é a thabhairt.)

It also requires non-EEA nationals who are present in the State to provide such a document or a registration certificate on demand to the Minister, an immigration officer or a Garda, if asked to do so to prove that they comply with their permission to remain in the State

Éilítear ar náisiúnaigh neamh-LEE atá láithreach sa Stát doiciméad nó teastas chlárú a thabhairt don Aire, d’oifigeach imirce nó do Gharda, má iarrtar orthu, chun cruthú um chomhlíonadh ceada fanacht sa Stát
This requirement does not apply to people under 16 years of age, but it does now apply to non-EEA nationals who were born in Ireland
Ní bhaineann an riachtanas seo le daoine faoi bhun 16 bliana d’aois ach baineann sé anois le náisiúnaigh neamh-LEE a rugadh in Éirinn
Section 34 does not apply to people who are exercising EU Treaty Rights of free movement
Ní bhaineann Alt 34 le daoine a fheidhmíonn an ceart atá acu chun saorghluaiseachta

However, anyone seeking to enter or live in the State on the basis of being an EEA national or a dependant of an EEA national is still required to provide satisfactory evidence of identity and nationality to establish that basis

Áfach, má iarrann aon duine cead teacht isteach nó cónaí in Éirinn ar bhonn náisiúntacht LEE nó cleithiúnaí náisiúnaigh LEE, ní mór dóibh leorfhianaise aitheantais agus náisiúntachta a sholáthar chun an bonn seo a fhaigh amach
For a visa for a non-EEA national family member: You must apply for a visa online
Iarratas ar víosa do bhall teaghlaigh náisiúnach neamh-LEE: Caithfidh tú cur isteach ar an víosa ar-líne
There are INIS guidelines about visa requirements for family reunification for workers (pdf)
Tá treoirlínte SEIÉ faoi riachtanais víosaí chun bhall teaghlaigh oíbrithe a athcheangal (pdf)
For a residence card for a non-EEA national qualifying family member, apply using application form EU 1 (pdf) and explanatory leaflet (pdf)
Iarratas ar chárta cónaithe do bhall teaghlaigh náisiúnach neamh-LEE cáilithe: úsáid foirm iarratais EU 1 (pdf) agus an bhileog mhínitheach (pdf) chun iarratas a sheoladh isteach
For a residence card for a non-EEA national permitted family member, apply using application form EU 1A (pdf) and explanatory leaflet (pdf)
Iarratas ar chárta cónaithe do bhall teaghlaigh náisiúnach neamh-LEE ceadaithe: úsáid foirm iarratais EU 1A (pdf) agus an bhileog mhínitheach (pdf) chun iarratas a sheoladh isteach
For a permanent residence certificate for an EU citizen who has lived in the State for 5 years apply using application form EU 2 (pdf) and explanatory leaflet (pdf)
Iarratas ar theastas do chónaí buan do shaoránach AE atá ina chónaí sa Stát ar feadh 5 bliana, úsáid foirm iarratais EU 2 (pdf) agus an bhileog mhínitheach (pdf) chun iarratas a sheoladh isteach
For a permanent residence card for a family member who has lived in the State for 5 years apply using application form EU 3 (pdf)and explanatory leaflet (pdf)
Iarratas ar chárta do chónaí buan do bhall teaghlaigh atá ina chónaí sa Stát ar feadh 5 bliana úsáid foirm iarratais EU 3 (pdf) agus an bhileog mhínitheach (pdf) chun iarratas a sheoladh isteach
Completed application forms should be returned to the EU Treaty Rights Section of the Irish Naturalisation and Immigration Service (INIS)
Caithfear foirmeacha comhlánaithe a sheoladh ar ais chuig Ionad Cearta Chonradh an AE ag Seirbhís Eadóirseachta agus Inimirce na hÉireann (SEIÉ)
If your EU 1, EU 2 or EU 3 application has been refused you can request a review of this decision using form EU 4 (pdf) and explanatory leaflet (pdf)
Má tá d'iarratas EU1, EU 2 nó EU 3 diúltaithe, is féidir iarratas ar athbhreathnú na cinneadh seo tríd an fhoirm EU 4 (pdf) agus an bhileog mhínitheach (pdf) a úsáid

Following divorce or annulment or the death or departure of the EU citizen, a holder of an EU1 residence card can apply to retain a residence card using application form EU5 (pdf) and explanatory leaflet (pdf)

I ndiaidh colscaradh nó neamhniú nó bás nó imeacht an saoránach AE, is féidir sealbhóir cárta cónaithe EU 1 iarratas a dhéanamh ar chárta cónaithe a choinneáil trí úsáid na foirme iarratais EU 5 (pdf) agus an bhileoig mhínitheach (pdf)
For an Immigration Certificate of Registration:
Chun Teastas Clárú Inimirce a fháil:
Apply to your local immigration registration office
Seol d’iarratas chuig d'oifigeach clárú inimirce áitiúil
In Dublin this is the Burgh Quay Registration Office - see 'Where to apply' below
Má tá cónaí ort i mBaile Átha Cliath, seol isteach é chuig Oifig Chlárúcháin Cé an Bhúrcaigh - féach 'Cá háit a dhéanfaidh mé iarratas' thíos
Since 15 September 2016, you must book an appointment online to visit it
Ó 15 Meán Fómhair 2016, caithfidh tú coinne a scríobh isteach ar líne chun cuairt a thabhairt air
Outside Dublin this is at your regional registration office or your local Garda District Headquarters
Lasmuigh de Bhaile Átha Cliath, seol isteach é chuig oifig chlárúcháin régiúnach nó chuig Ceanncheathrú Ceantair an Gharda Síochána
If you are in a de facto relationship you can find information about permission to remain on the INIS website
Má tá tú i ngaol eisphósta nó de facto tá tuilleadh eolais faoi chead fanacht ar an suíomh BNGI
You can read more about non-EEA family reunification in the policy guidelines (pdf) available on the INIS website
Is féidir léamh tuilleadh faoi bhall teaghlaigh neamh-LEE a athcheangal sna treoirlínte polasaí (pdf) ar fáil ar an suíomh SEIÉ
